intro: Antennaria parlinii var. farwellii, commonly known as Farwell's mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosettes. The plant features small, hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, dry habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
